Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class Market

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.Market
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Market extends Object implements Serializable
Here lies the marble matrix logic, with initialization and player selection

    MarbleColor
    getColor​(int row, int column)

    List<MarbleColor>
    selectColumn​(int column)
    Method selectColumn takes the index of a column, shifts the column selected following the game's rules, and returns the list of the taken marbles (the marbles that were in that column in the beginning)
    List<MarbleColor>
    selectRow​(int row)
    Method selectRow takes the index of a row, shifts the row selected following the game's rules, and returns the list of the taken marbles (the marbles that were in that row in the beginning)

  • Method Details

    • getColor

      public MarbleColor getColor​(int row, int column)
      Method getColor is a getter of one of the marbles inside the Market (not the slide marble) Insert 0 for the first row from above, 1 for the second one ecc.
      Parameters:
      row - of the marble you want to get
      column - of the marble you want to get
      Returns:
      the marble in that position of the market

    • getSlideMarble

      public MarbleColor getSlideMarble()
      Method getSlideMarble is the getter of the slide marble
      Returns:
      the slide marble

    • selectColumn

      public List<MarbleColor> selectColumn​(int column)
      Method selectColumn takes the index of a column, shifts the column selected following the game's rules, and returns the list of the taken marbles (the marbles that were in that column in the beginning)
      Parameters:
      column - is the index of the column you want to select (0,1,2,3)
      Returns:
      the list of the taken (bought) marbles

    • selectRow

      public List<MarbleColor> selectRow​(int row)
      Method selectRow takes the index of a row, shifts the row selected following the game's rules, and returns the list of the taken marbles (the marbles that were in that row in the beginning)
      Parameters:
      row - is the index of the row you want to select (0,1,2)
      Returns:
      the list of the taken (bought) marbles

    • getRowColors

      public List<MarbleColor> getRowColors​(int row)
      Returns:
      a list containing all the colours in a specific row

    • getColumnColors

      public List<MarbleColor> getColumnColors​(int column)
      Returns:
      a list containing all the colours in a specific column
